de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing

Class EditDatabaseDialogue

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.control.Dialog<java.lang.Void>
      • de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing.EditDatabaseDialogue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class EditDatabaseDialogue
extends javafx.scene.control.Dialog<java.lang.Void>

    An window that handles the editing of the database. For reasons of modality, it extends the Dialog class, but does not return anything. As every modification of the database will be immediately uploaded to the online database, any user who wishes to use this functionality must authorise themselves in advance.

    Any unauthorised user must not have access to this dialogue!

    Modifying the database via this graphical interface should be preferred over the use of third party tools (phpMyAdmin, ...) as it implements validity features that will prevent faulty input.

    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)
    See Also:
    AddTranscriptionPane, OnlineHandler, LoginDialogue

      • allowTransPaneSorting

        private boolean allowTransPaneSorting
        This variable is necessary to avoid infinite looping when a new AddTranscriptionPane is added to the itemsBox. It functions as a token that prevents the change listener from calling itself.
        See Also:
        transPaneSortingLock

      • transPaneSortingLock

        private java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock transPaneSortingLock
        This lock is necessary to avoid infinite looping when a new AddTranscriptionPane is added to the itemsBox.
        See Also:
        allowTransPaneSorting

      • EditDatabaseDialogue

        public EditDatabaseDialogue(AbstractDatabaseEditingHandler handler)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.net.URISyntaxException
        Constructor for the EditDatabaseDialogue.
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to use for communicating with the database.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the FXMLLoader throws one.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the FXMLProvider throws one.

    • Method Detail

      • onInputReceived

        private void onInputReceived(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        Should be called when a key is pressed inside the lemmaField. If the KeyCode belonging to the given key event equals ENTER or TAB, lemmaButton is fired for user convenience.
        Parameters:
        event - the corresponding key event.

      • onOkButtonPressed

        private void onOkButtonPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Should be called when the lemmaButton fires. Starts the editing process for the currently typed in lemma unless there are for example illegal characters found inside of it or any exceptions are thrown database-wise.
        Parameters:
        event - the corresponding action event.

      • validateInput

        private boolean validateInput(java.lang.String input)
        Determines whether or not the given String can function as a valid lemma. This means that it must not containt any non-word characters or digits.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to evaluate.
        Returns:
        true if the given String is a valid lemma; false otherwise.

      • populateEditingPane

        private void populateEditingPane(DatabaseEntry entry)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Populates the itemsBox with the appropriate AddTranscriptionPanes if the given DatabaseEntry is not empty. Otherwise, an empty add transcription pane is added at least.
        Parameters:
        entry - the database entry to populate the items box with.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any call to the AddTranscriptionPane constructor should throw one.
        See Also:
        AddTranscriptionPane, DatabaseEntry

      • addEmptyTranscriptionPane

        private void addEmptyTranscriptionPane(java.lang.String lemma)
        Adds an empty AddTranscriptionPane to the itemsBox, meaning that the respective constructor will be called with a newly-created DatabaseEntry causing the transcription pane to be initialised with empty values.
        Parameters:
        lemma - the lemma to use.

      • removeTranscriptionPane

        private void removeTranscriptionPane(int transID)
        Removes the AddTranscriptionPane from the itemsBox whose TranscriptionItem's id matches the given one. If there is no such element, nothing will happen.
        Parameters:
        transID - the ID of the transcription item that should be removed.

      • getCurrentLemma

        public java.lang.String getCurrentLemma()
        Getter for the currently typed in lemma. Note that this function does not perform any validity check.
        Returns:
        the current lemma.
        See Also:
        lemmaField

      • setLemmaFeedback

        private void setLemmaFeedback(FeedbackMode mode,
                              java.lang.String message)
        Updates the lemmaFeedbackLabel and inputValidityIcon based on the given parameters. Should be called by instances of the EditDatabaseDialogue.FeedbackProvider.
        Parameters:
        mode - the desired feedback mode.
        message - the message to be displayed.
